means: bloom ： 主要指诸如牡丹、玫瑰、梅花、菊花等供观赏的花以及花的状态。
blossom ： 一般指树木开花，尤指果树上开的花。
flower ： 指开放的花朵或泛指花卉。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English flour, from Old French flour, flor, from Latin flos, flor-. The original spelling was no longer in use by the late 17th cent. except in its specialized sense 'ground grain' (see flour)

encyclopedia.content: 漫画 名称：FLOWER 漫画分类：日韩漫画 爱情类 连载状态：已完结（共10卷） 漫画作者：和田尚子 故事介绍： 14岁的葵在杂志社打工，做读者模特儿，是个开朗的女孩。她目前的梦想是，与龙太等好朋友们一同考进南高。然而某一天，想都没想到的意外支突然降临…… 作者介绍：和田尚子，女，出生于1960年六月七日，双子座，O型血。 漫画名称；Flower 编绘；米奇 故事介绍 每个人的心中，都盛开着只属于自己的花吧。它的颜色和香气，从

entry.def: A flower is the part of a plant which is often brightly coloured, grows at the end of a stem, and only survives for a short time.
A flower is a stem of a plant that has one or more flowers on it and has been picked, usually with others, for example to give as a present or to put in a vase.

example.ex: ...a bunch of flowers sent by a new admirer.
example.tran: 又一个仰慕者送来的一束鲜花

entry.def: Flowers are small plants that are grown for their flowers as opposed to trees, shrubs, and vegetables.

example.ex: ...a lawned area surrounded by plants and flowers...
example.tran: 周围种着植物和花卉的草地

example.ex: The flower garden will be ablaze with colour every day.
example.tran: 花园每天都将开满各色鲜花。

entry.def: When a plant or tree flowers, its flowers appear and open.

example.ex: Several of these rhododendrons will flower this year for the first time.
example.tran: 这些杜鹃花有些将在今年首度开花。

entry.def: When something flowers, for example a political movement or a relationship, it gets stronger and more successful.

example.tran: 他们的关系最终开花结果了。

entry.def: A person or thing that is described as the flower of something is the best part or example of it.

example.ex: Those killed have been described as the flower of Polish manhood.
example.tran: 那些牺牲者被称为波兰男子中的精英。

entry.def: When a plant is in flower or when it has come into flower, its flowers have appeared and opened.

example.ex: Some of the daffodils are still in flower...
As one plant fades, another comes into flower.
example.tran: 一株植物凋谢了，另一株又会盛开。

means.word_mean: 1. a plant cultivated for its blooms or blossoms
2. reproductive organ of angiosperm plants especially one having showy or colorful parts
3. the period of greatest prosperity or productivity
